snippet: About 350 police officers in Ankara, the capital, were removed from their posts overnight, Turkish news outlets reported.
abstract: About 350 police officers in Turkish capital Ankara are removed from their posts, largest single purge of police force since government corruption investigation began in December; analysts see dismissals as part of continuing effort by Prime Min Tayyip Recep Erdogan's government to marginalize those it believes are driving investigation.

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and SEBNEM ARSU
byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky reported from Paris, and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: About 350 police officers in Ankara, the capital, were removed from their posts overnight, Turkish news outlets reported.

headline.main: Purge of Police Said to Be Move by Turkey to Disrupt Graft Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Purge of Police Said to Be Move by Turkey to Disrupt Graft Inquiry
